message.content:
cs.DS, cs.FL, cs.LO, cs.SY, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with finite automata and their properties, which are typically studied in the sub-category of computer science called "Discrete Mathematics" (cs.DM). However, the use of weights in the max-plus semiring suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of "Formal Languages and Automata Theory" (cs.FL). The paper's focus on decidability and constructive proofs suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-category of "Logic in Computer Science" (cs.LO). The use of automata in control systems and the mention of sequentiality suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of "Systems and Control" (cs.SY). Finally, the use of series and ambiguity suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of "Information Theory" (cs.IT).
